title: Google\Cloud\NetworkManagement\V1\Endpoint
name: Endpoint
description:
Source or destination of the Connectivity Test.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.networkmanagement.v1.Endpoint

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.ip_address
params.description: The IP address of the endpoint, which can be an external or internal IP. An IPv6 address is only allowed when the test's destination is a global load balancer VIP.

params.name: data.port
params.description: The IP protocol port of the endpoint. Only applicable when protocol is TCP or UDP.

params.name: data.gke_master_cluster
params.description: A cluster URI for Google Kubernetes Engine master.

params.name: data.network_type
params.description: Type of the network where the endpoint is located. Applicable only to source endpoint, as destination network type can be inferred from the source.

params.name: data.project_id
params.description: Project ID where the endpoint is located. The Project ID can be derived from the URI if you provide a VM instance or network URI. The following are two cases where you must provide the project ID: 1. Only the IP address is specified, and the IP address is within a GCP project. 2. When you are using Shared VPC and the IP address that you provide is from the service project. In this case, the network that the IP address resides in is defined in the host project.

methods.name: getIpAddress
methods.description:
The IP address of the endpoint, which can be an external or internal IP.

An IPv6 address is only allowed when the test's destination is a global load balancer VIP.

params.description:

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description:
Project ID where the endpoint is located.

The Project ID can be derived from the URI if you provide a VM instance or network URI. The following are two cases where you must provide the project ID:

  1. Only the IP address is specified, and the IP address is within a GCP project.
  2. When you are using Shared VPC and the IP address that you provide is from the service project. In this case, the network that the IP address resides in is defined in the host project.

Generated from protobuf field string project_id = 6;

The Project ID can be derived from the URI if you provide a VM instance or network URI. The following are two cases where you must provide the project ID:

  2. When you are using Shared VPC and the IP address that you provide is from the service project. In this case, the network that the IP address resides in is defined in the host project.
